Package org.zaproxy.zap.extension.script

Interface ProxyScript

public interface ProxyScript
A script that will be executed when a proxied request is ready to be forwarded to the server and when the response is ready to be forwarded to the client.

Note: In the presence of more than one script or listener (for example, ProxyListener and HttpSenderListener) there are no guarantees that the (final) request/response is exactly the same as the one crafted by this script, or, that the request/response is actually going to be forwarded, as the following scripts/listeners may modify it or drop it.

Since:
2.2.0

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    proxyRequest(HttpMessage msg)
    Called when a request is received from the client.
    boolean
    proxyResponse(HttpMessage msg)
    Called after receiving the response from a proxied request.

  • Method Details

    • proxyRequest

      boolean proxyRequest(HttpMessage msg) throws ScriptException
      Called when a request is received from the client.

      Both the request and response of the HTTP message may be modified. If a response is set the request is not forwarded to the server, thus preventing the request and overriding the response. If the return value is true the request may be forwarded and the following scripts/listeners will be called, if the value is false the request is dropped and no more scripts/listeners will be called.

      Parameters:
      msg - the HTTP message (request) being proxied/sent.
      Returns:
      true if the request should be forwarded to the server, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      ScriptException - if an error occurred while executing the script.

    • proxyResponse

      boolean proxyResponse(HttpMessage msg) throws ScriptException
      Called after receiving the response from a proxied request.

      If the return value is true the response may be forwarded and the following scripts/listeners will be called, if the value is false the response will not be forwarded and no more scripts/listeners will be called.

      Parameters:
      msg - the HTTP message (response) received (or overridden by a script/listener).
      Returns:
      true if the response should be forwarded to the client, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      ScriptException - if an error occurred while executing the script.
